attributes.action: Care Home Crisis: Reinstate our licence to continue sponsoring current migrants
attributes.background: ARMSCARE is a care home group, whose licence to sponsor skilled migrant workers was revoked and despite efforts to remedy any errors, our skilled migrant workforce were given 60 days to leave the country. Ensuring our current staff stay, will guarantee the best quality of service to our residents.
attributes.additional_details:
We are an open and honest care home group that aims to provide the best quality of care to our residents and by forcing our staff to leave; it removes the very essence of quality and skill from our core business. 

Recruiting local staff or staff willing to relocate to Norfolk is proving to be virtually impossible because villages such as Docking do not have a regular mobile phone signal, let alone any regular public transport for commuters.
For further information please see: www.armscare.co.uk

attributes.action: Government invokes article 50 by the end of 2016
attributes.background: As you all know the people of the UK voted to leave the EU on June 23rd 2016, the process can only begin after the Government has invoked Article 50. A few people who do not wish to accept that vote are calling for another referendum, we need to press ahead or we may cause civil unrest in the UK.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of cruel halal meat in the UK
attributes.background: Stop the cruel slaughter of innocent animals for halal meat. Stop the sale of halal meat in UK.

attributes.action: Bring back the DEATH penalty for PAEDOPHILES.
attributes.background: Shield Appeal is a campaign to protect the babies and children of our country . We all want the death penalty for PAEDOPHILES.
attributes.additional_details: We can't continue to allow the babies of our country to be raped and abused by these beasts . They all need to die . No more prison, no more costing the tax payers millions of pounds . Hang them .

attributes.action: Follow France and force shops to donate food waste to charities.
attributes.background:
Every year in the UK 18 million tonnes of food end up in landfill.

Approx 1/3 from producers/ supply chain, 1/3 from retail and 1/3 from households.

Annual value : £23 BILLION 

Disposal costs to business passed on to consumers in higher prices, landfill costs in local taxes – less income
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/may/22/uk-tops-chart-of-eu-food-waste

http://www.foodawarecic.org.uk/stats-2/

attributes.action: Increase standard benefit amount for ESA, & improve screening process for PIP.
attributes.background:
Thousands of people are too scared to apply for benefits, due to fear of losing current benefits or being taken to court 

The amount for ESA is £57 per week. PIP is awarded if you qualify at a testing centre, where 'not looking tired enough' will get your application declined.
attributes.additional_details:
I am part of a fibromyalgia support page, and a bipolar support page. Both of these pages are full of people who are applying for PIP and ESA, and being turned down due to 'not looking tired enough' (fibromyalgia sufferer), 'being able to be woken up by strangers at their stop on a bus' (narcolepsy sufferer), 'being mobile' when the person has to use an electric wheelchair paid for by themselves due to benefit refusal (fibromyalgia sufferer) 

Austerity is being applied in the wrong places.

attributes.action: Stop building houses on green land while there is a mass of derelict buildings.
attributes.background: At present we are in a housing crisis which developers are going about the wrong way. We need to be building on brownfield land and refurbishing, converting or rebuilding derelict buildings for new homes. We're destroying our green land at an alarming rate which needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details: There are large amounts of abandoned buildings and factories all over the country that have been left for numerous years to fall in to decay and some even demolished and left. We need to be building on these areas before destroying our countryside with  housing developments.

attributes.action: Make it law for the tethering of horses to be a criminal offence.
attributes.background: A tethered horse is a horse on a length of chain. Unable to move beyond the confines of the chain and often without shelter, sufficient grazing and water. Many are tethered 24/7 and spend their days going round and round in circles. They are not living, just existing. You can help end this.
attributes.additional_details: If you would like to see instances of tethered horses and how  despondent and resigned to their fate they look then visit the Facebook page of  Save the Papermill Horses.

attributes.action: Make more treatments available on the NHS for Lipoedema patients.
attributes.background: Lipoedema is a genetic adipose tissue disorder which causes patients legs & arms to grow largely out of proportion. This can be an incredibly painful, embarrassing & debilitating condition. It's estimated to affect 11% of women worldwide
attributes.additional_details: The only way to effectively treat this condition is surgery. It doesn't just effect women, lipoedema can effect men as well. Patients with Lipoedema have painful, enlarged, lumpy, misshaped and often badly bruised arms and legs. Currently patients are left to suffer as the disfiguration of the limbs becomes more pronounced, the pain increases and their mobility and enjoyment of everyday activities decreases. Please sign this petition and get the Lipoedema patients the treatment they deserve.

attributes.action: That MPs should debate and vote on an inquiry into the events at Orgreve
attributes.background: they has been a lot of distrust between workers and the police due to the suspicion that the events on 18 June 1984 between police and pickets at a British Steel Corporation plant in Orgreave, South Yorkshire.

attributes.action: Direct Councils to use the Mobile Home powers devolved to them, without option.
attributes.background: A 'criminal element' have been acquiring Sites. They use brutal intimidation to frighten elderly residents and they ignore any regulations. Although Councils have enormous powers under Planning and Licencing  they are reluctant to get involved, even when there is overwhelming evidence.
attributes.additional_details:
The main legislation is the 1960 Caravan Act, the 1983  Mobile Home Act and the 2013 Mobile Home Act. Councils have been lethargic and even negligent in their policing of these Acts. 

There is a Parliamentary Working Group monitoring the 2013 Act, but they are not going to report until July 2017. The legislation must be made to work now and the rouges must either change their ways, or be relieved of the ownership of their Sites. Too many elderly residents are suffering hardship and abuse.

attributes.action: Abolish same roof rule and 1979 rule for historic sexual abuse victims
attributes.background: If you were abused by a family member living in the same household the Ministry of Justice thinks that's ok. If your abuse ended prior to October 1979 that's ok too. The CICA will not pay out any form of compensation if you fall into either of these categories, an unfair and unjust rule.
attributes.additional_details: My father and mother were recently jailed for what he did to me as a child I and my sisters were told to make a claim for compensation. We did but as my abuse ended in July 1979 and it was my father that sexually abused me the law says it was ok and I am entitled to nothing. This is not about the money this is about another slap in the face for abuse victims coming forward it needs to be changed.

attributes.action: The UK will not leave the single market without a further referendum.
attributes.background: Throughout the referendum campaign, the public has been promised that full access to the single market can be maintained and it was on this basis that the narrow "Leave" victory margin (52/48) was achieved. It would be catastrophic for the UK economy if this access were given up or diluted.

attributes.action: Referendums should require a two thirds majority to mandate any change
attributes.background: Without a clear majority referendums can be divisive and lead to uncertain outcomes. Any mandate for a change in a referendum should therefore require the support of at least two thirds of those voting and over 50% of those eligible to vote.
attributes.additional_details: British political parties generally require two thirds of the those voting to approve any constitutional change, as do many democratic nations.  This requirement acts a s a safeguard to ensure any change is clearly wanted and does not lead to future instability. A referendum should only be held to deal with important issues which are in themselves likely to have constitutional implications.  So it is reasonable to expect any vote for change made via a referendum to be similarly safeguarded.

attributes.action: No confidence vote in Amber Rudd as home secretary
attributes.background: We the 17 million who voted to leave,have no confidence in amber rudd as home secretary..Her performance during the debates was appalling and very childish..We expect a brexit home secretary asap.Who will deliver what we have asked for and will be fit for the job.
attributes.additional_details: Theresa may must accept and do the will of the undersigned ..We should of had a vote for who runs our government.

attributes.action: Reform the democratic system to work honestly for the people it serves.
attributes.background:
Many people voted for Brexit to regain power. The ‘remain’ people want the same. It unites us both. We all want to have control over our own lives. Primarily this depends on a government genuinely working for us. This requires a total reformation of our systems of democracy. 
So we demand,
attributes.additional_details:
Proportional representation.
A published declaration of party policies/intentions before general elections, which must be held.
Early general elections called if those promises are broken.
An elected upper house.
A cap on donations of £5000 - instead state funding for a system owned by the people it serves and policies not able to be bought.
A law ensuring the media correct any inaccuracies or misleading statements on the same page, fitting format with the original article, with an apology.

attributes.action: Make education about domestic violence part of the school curriculum.
attributes.background: Domestic violence is a huge hidden issue within the UK. Everyday, individuals in harmful relationships are physically and emotionally abused, which directly impacts the lives of children involved.Therefore education on this issue could provide a lifeline for those impacted, and prevent future abuse.

attributes.action: Implement stronger sentences for those convicted of assaulting police officers
attributes.background: Assaults on police officers have dramatically risen, with officers frequently being attacked in the line of duty. Police officers put their lives on the line protecting citizens every day and the lack of respect that people who attack them show should be reflected through stronger sentences.
attributes.additional_details: I am a serving officer with the Metropolitan Police service and have heard about and witnessed first hand details of assaults on colleagues. Colleagues who whilst on patrol get spat at, bitten, punched, kicked, sometimes repeatedly, violently assaulted. Only today two police officers were admitted to hospital in London after being assaulted challenging a youth who was carrying a knife. Police officers need to be shown respect for serving the population, and this needs to be shown via sentencing

attributes.action: Introduction of Mental Health into National Curriculum and Hospitals
attributes.background:
We truly believe that more needs to be done in relation to suicide.

There should be no stigma attached to Mental Health and the only way to eradicate a stigma surrounding a 'taboo' subject is to educate by bringing it into National Curriculum and more information/care available in hospitals.
attributes.additional_details:
6581 committed suicide in 2014 alone, each and everyone of those people had a family, friends and countless people that would have been touched by their passing.
We passionately believe that the rates of suicide would decrease if Mental Health was part of the National Curriculum and the younger generation were aware of what symptoms to look out for in themselves and those around them
With that we also believe that there's room for improvement with information and Mental Health care in hospitals

attributes.action: Increase minimum wage for 18+ year olds to the same as the national living wage
attributes.background:
At the age of 18 you have to pay ADULT prices, if we are having to pay adult prices we should be paid the same! Additionally if we are doing the SAME job as someone 25 we should get the SAME pay! 

Some 18-24 year olds have families etc with bills and rent to pay the same as 25+ year olds!

attributes.action: Delete "journalism, art or literature" exemptions from the FOI Act
attributes.background: Schedule 1, Part VI of the Freedom Of Information Act 2000 lists a number of organisations granted special exemption, where the Act only applies to information "held for purposes other than those of journalism, art or literature". This is misused to reject ANY FOI requests they'd rather not answer.
attributes.additional_details:
They use a very loose interpretation of this exemption to support these rejections, as everything they do can be linked back to one of these three categories.

They make frequent use of the Act to interrogate other public sector organisations in their journalistic research, yet use the JAoL clause to shield themselves from similar investigation.

We therefore request that these exemptions be deleted from the FOI Act, leaving them open to the same level of scrutiny as other public bodies.

attributes.action: Include third sector workers on SOL to prevent them being forced out of the UK
attributes.background:
Tier 2 skilled workers must meet a £35k p/a salary threshold to remain in the UK. This makes it impossible for them to work in 3rd sector roles.
The Shortage Occupation List has been used to prevent nurses being removed from the UK. It must now be used to save charity workers, and charities.
attributes.additional_details:
Charities, voluntary organisations and social enterprises desperately need Tier 2 skilled workers, especially in IT etc, but can't match  private or civil sector salaries to entice the best workers.
It is impossible for a Tier 2 worker to switch to a Tier 5 route, which forbids a permanent job.
The Home Office must ask the Migration Advisory Committee to research the possibility of including third sector workers on the SOL.
Find out moreat stop35k.org

attributes.action: Review and change criteria that allow people to donate blood
attributes.background: Currently huge groups of people, such as men who have sex with men, are unable to donate blood, due to creteria based on out of date views and stereotypes. These need to be reviewed and the discrimination needs to stop! There are always adverts crying out for donors but they stop those willing!
attributes.additional_details: A gay man in a long term monogamous relationship can be denied as a donor, where a heterosexual man sleeping with multiple partners is allowed. This outdated view on men who have sex with men is fuelling the discrimination faced by them on a daily basis. This needs to be reviewed and changed and then perhaps there wouldn't be as many shortages. MSMs can be on the organ donor register and can sign up to the Anthony Nolan Trust so why shouldn't they be able to donate blood

attributes.action: Reduce the fees for citizenship application for EU nationals
attributes.background: In response to the latest "Brexit"referendum results, we the undersigned call upon HM Government, to reduce the fees for citizenship application for EU nationals who have been living and working in the UK for over 6 years
attributes.additional_details:
Currently to apply for British Naturalisation we have to pay £1,236.00
plus other expenses for the  "met the knowledge of English" and "life in the UK" tests

attributes.action: Make School Allergy Action Groups Standard Practice for All Schools in the UK
attributes.background: Cases of Anaphylaxis are rising in the UK. Schools have a statutory duty of care to support children with medical conditions. Allergies can be life threatening. We believe every school should adopt good practice in the way of School Allergy Action Groups as soon as practically possible.
attributes.additional_details: Schools are still left to write their own health and safety policies including those relating to allergies within the school setting. Adopting good practice (such as advocated by Allergy UK) in setting up School Allergy Action Groups/SAAG will enable school staff, pupils, parents, governors and providers (e.g.caterers) to collaborate in ensuring school is as safe as possible for those affected by life threatening allergies. It will reduce risks, save time, money and potentially lives.

attributes.action: Make impersonation of a Paramedic a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Paramedics work hard to get their registration and lean the skills to save a life,however there is an increasing number of people impersonating paramedics. This puts patient saftey at risk and the police. At present it is not illegal to do this unlike impersonating a police officer.

attributes.action: Fathers should automatically be granted 50% custody of their children by law
attributes.background: At present a father needs to fight to have 50% access to their child. A child that is legally a mother and fathers. A child needs a father just as much as a mother and the current legislation is not only stuck in the dark ages but favours considerably the mother. This needs to change.

attributes.action: Re-open Hemel Hempstead Hospital
attributes.background: Sign to try help re open Hemel Hempstead hospital.

attributes.action:
Michaela's Law
Make it law that all council run parks have CCTV in play areas
attributes.background: My 10 yr old daughter was seriously assaulted by a 45 yr old adult in July 2016.There wasn't CCTV and because of this my daughters attacker got away with it.If there had been CCTV my daughter and family wouldn't have had to go through what we are now.The long term psychological impact is devastating
attributes.additional_details: Please support this so that no other family has to go through what we are going through. Children should be safe guarded and protected in this day an age. All children are entitled to play freely and feel safe at all times.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to dump animals.
attributes.background: Many charities like Animal Aid have to rescue many dumped kittens and puppies on a daily basis because of people just abandoning them on the street in a box. I want it to be illegal to dump animals and for people who do to be never allowed to have pets again.

attributes.action: Put tackling climate change at the top of the government's agenda.
attributes.background: For too long climate change has been a secondary consideration, yet it is the defining challenge of our time. I call on the government to create a separate department and minister of state for climate change, and to make climate change a central consideration of all future policy-making decisions.
attributes.additional_details:
We must rapidly increase investment in research and technologies to understand climate science, realise new technologies, quickly decarbonise our economy and increase our resillience to future uncertainty. This can wait no longer. We need strong leadership from this government. Even the possibility of accelerating climate change should shock us out of complacency.
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/science/climate-change-game-over-global-warming-climate-sensitivity-seven-degrees-a7407881.html

attributes.action: Pass a law preventing the resale of event tickets by any company or website
attributes.background: Too many websites and companies exist or promote the resale of event tickets for vastly more than the original face value. No entity should be allowed to purchase by any means any number of tickets if their sole intent is to profit by reselling at inflated prices. The law should protect face values.
attributes.additional_details: Even on the opening day of sale of tickets on sites like Stereoboard, Axn, ticketmaster  it's virtually impossible to find tickets at face value. Instead tickets are immediately sold out, but on the same opening day resell prices are always immediately available at x2, x3 and more than face value. This is outrageous and should be illegal. Only honest fans should be able to buy tickets and the resale should be strictly controlled to face value plus reasonable postage, like standard 1st class.

attributes.action: Make Bromethalin rat poison illegal in the U.K. Because of the dangers to pets
attributes.background: On Friday the 14th of October 2016 I found my cat grubby and walking into things,she was a wild cat and was always outside.we noticed she was walking into things and her eyes looked weird, we realised she was blind. We brought her to the vet and they referred us to the hospital.
attributes.additional_details: On Friday the 14th of October 2016 I found my cat grubby and walking into things,she was a wild cat and was always outside.we noticed she was walking into things and her eyes looked weird, we realised she was blind. We brought her to the vet and they referred us to the hospital for her they said they would keep her over night, we got a call the next morning.she had been sick green stuff and she was much worse the vet said she was poisoned by a type of rat poison and we had to put her down.

attributes.action: Legalise use of medical marijuana for chronic pain (and other conditions)
attributes.background:
Myself (and many others in the UK) struggle daily with chronic pain and other painful problems out of our control.

Why should patients suffer major side effects from pain meds meaning they are unable to function normally in day to day life leading to job insecurity, and reducing their dignity.
attributes.additional_details:
"Almost 10 million Britons suffer pain almost daily resulting in a major impact on their quality of life and more days off work." - https://www.britishpainsociety.org/media-resources/

"Medical Marijuana Seems Safe for Chronic Pain" - http://www.webmd.com/pain-management/news/20151007/medical-marijuana-seems-safe-for-chronic-pain-patients-study-finds

"Cannabis use... better quality of life in patients with chronic pain." - http://www.jpain.org/article/S1526-5900(16)00567-8/abstract

attributes.action: Amend animal welfare act to ban the practice of giving away animals as prizes.
attributes.background:
Calling upon the ban of ALL animals given as prizes to any age not just under the age of 16. 
The Animal Welfare Act 2006 in England and Wales makes it an offence to give away an animal as a prize if the person can reasonably be believed to be under 16 and is not accompanied by an adult.
attributes.additional_details: This is not the case in Scotland, where under the Animal Health and Welfare (Scotland) Act 2006, it is an offence to offer or give an animal to another person as a prize (whatever their age), except where it is offered in a family context.

attributes.action: Penalties against custodians turning away people accompanied by Assistance Dogs
attributes.background: Access discrimination to become a criminal offence with hefty statuatory fines put in place with further offenses increasing the fines given and lead to liquor, transport, or trading license being revoked
attributes.additional_details:
Across the UK, there are currently over 6,700 disabled and impaired people who have become the recipient of Assistance Dogs, specially trained to help them so that their disability is less of the daily burden it was before.
In 2010 the Government abolished the Disability Discrimination Act 1995, replacing it with the Equality Act 2010. This Act is insufficient in making companies fall in line with such procedures. This must be addressed with penalties put in place for non-compliance.

attributes.action: Stop classifying cats as "property" under UK law
attributes.background: Recently in the U.K. there have been a number of cases of people killing cats, U.K. Law means these people are only charged with damage to property, the law needs changing to reflect reality, that cats are not property but family members.
attributes.additional_details: The law for a long time has failed animals, we now need to start punishing these crimes accordingly. There is an acknowledged link between animal cruelty and violence against other humans, another reason that classifying a breathing living creature as "property" is barbaric.

attributes.action: Intervene  NOW with the Government of Indonesia to  reprieve Lindsay SandIford
attributes.background: The severity of the sentence was greeted with shock because prosecutors had not recommended the death penalty for Sandiford. The ruling was also condemned by the British government and anti–death penalty campaigners. It's also contrary to International Law, which we should uphold and enforce!
attributes.additional_details: Guardian articles , 28 April 2016,and 14 June 2016. Wickipaedia entry "Linsay Sandiford. Numerous other press reports in all reputable newspapers and international media

attributes.action: Change Family Court Orders regarding Parental Alienation.
attributes.background:
Family Court Orders to automatically state

"Neither parent should cause intentional Parental Alienation including Psychology Manipulation & Isolation of Parental Responsibilities"

Parental Alienation has huge effects on children IE: Their education, mental, emotional state & causes anxieties.
attributes.additional_details:
This would exclude: Domestic Violence or if an Injunctions in place

What's Parental Alienation? 
It is the Physiology Manipulation of young children & isolation of a Parents Responsibilities. PR Example: Schooling, Health, Religion, General decisions on bringing up of the child.

Many parents that take their child's legal guardian to court & leave to find they have the same issues.

Adding this to court orders would resolve this PA issue.

More info: parentalalienation.webs.com

attributes.action: Decisions must be issued within 6 months after asylum is claimed
attributes.background:
We deplore the fact that the Home Office is failing to issue decisions about the future of asylum seekers in a timely manner. 
It is clear that many clients are waiting over a year, which contravenes EU guidelines and poses a breach of their human rights.
attributes.additional_details:
We ask the Home Office to obey their own guidelines which state that a decision will be made within 6 months after an asylum claim is made, and not the years many are experiencing today.
These people have fled to this country for political or religious reasons and are desperate to work, study and find their own home. They are prevented from doing this while waiting long overdue decisions by the Home Office. 
As a direct result, many suffer from mental health issues including stress, depression, sleeplessness, anxiety and physical problems. 
We therefore call on the Home Office to do everything in their power to give decisions within six months and to issue regular reports on the proportion of cases in which this is achieved.

attributes.action: Stop parents who maliciously deny the other parent access to their children
attributes.background: There are many examples of one parent who stops the other parent from having access to their own children for no good reason other than their own gain and take no consideration of the best interests of their children as often the children will have a strong relationship with the alienated parent
attributes.additional_details: When this happens there can be a long wait for resolution through mediation and/or courts of months. Before any formal hearings take place, it should be illegal for parents to do this and revision of the children and families act is required to give police greater powers of discretion to enforce equal contact where malicious behaviour is proven. Currently there is no support for alienated parents in the interim period before formal proceedings. This must change and made criminal.

attributes.action: Make Security Industry Authority reform systems, processes and payment schemes
attributes.background: The SIA was designed to improve security standards across the UK and enforce the PSI act, however many people in the industry are unhappy with the pricing structure and lack of support given by the SIA. A review of the ACS pricing is required to make it affordable to small businesses
attributes.additional_details:
The ACS is overpriced for many smaller companies and is a requirement of tenders, therefore the scheme is damaging small businesses.

The SIA advised thousands of companies to proceed with ISO 9001 or ACS in preparation for business licence - these clients were misinformed and want a review of how this happened.

More support and training needed, not fines. People feel they are just interested in money

Internal computer system isn't fit for purpose 

Phone lines to be brought online for public

attributes.action: Abolish universal credit and resort back to tried and tested benefits system
attributes.background: An increasing number of customers are suffering severe hardship because of the new system. I myself have been waiting 3 months to be paid. Costs to call the service are ridiculous for those on a low income amd letters are being issued deliberatly encouraging people to waste precious money on calls.
attributes.additional_details: Increasing number of stories and requests for help are being posted online all over the country. Those of us forced onto universal credit are suffering severe hardship and un realistic sanctions aswell as ridiculous call charges to speak to ill informed poorly trained and rude staff who have no idea how to resolve issues with one member of staff admitting that letters requesting information are simply to entice people to call the premium rate telephone number. Restore the benefits system!

attributes.action: Urge the NHS to back the 8-week blood sugar diet method to avoid T2 Diabetes.
attributes.background: Increasing numbers of people are recovering from type 2 diabetes without drugs using the nutrition based 8-week blood sugar diet method at a time when instances of limb amputations, blindness and other complications are rising dramatically.
attributes.additional_details:
Reference 1: "The 8-week blood sugar diet method" by Dr Michael Mosley and Prof. Roy Taylor

Reference 2: Colin Beattie MSP (successful use of this method)

Reference 3: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-3404259/Eat-beat-diabetes-just-eight-weeks-s-life-changing-diet-help-avoid-reverse-Type-2-diabetes-best-s-tasty-way-health.html

attributes.action: Repeal the decision that forces hospitals to stop providing heart surgery.
attributes.background: Three hospitals in Leicester, Manchester and London have just been ordered to stop surgery on patients born with heart disorders by April 2017. This puts the lives of many patients at risk. Force our government to invest in heart units and not to abandon those, like me, with heart conditions.
attributes.additional_details: If a standard of care is deemed unsatisfactory every effort should be made to raise that standard considerably to save lives. Our government shouldn't be abandoning people with heart disorders and rejecting the phenomenal work of those doctors who strive to provide the best care for their patients. This decision will also force patients and their families to travel great and costly distances. The government is putting lives at an even greater risk by shutting down these services.

attributes.action: Ultra sound scans of ovaries as part of the smear screening process
attributes.background: My name is Sam. I'm a 31 year old mother of 2. I've always stayed up to date with my checks. Having had a baby 8 month ago delivered by c section I had a tender pain in my abdomen still to this day. After being admitted to A&E suspected appendicitis. It turns out I have a 17cm cyst on my ovary
attributes.additional_details:
If it wasn't for the sharp pain I experienced one day. I would never have know about this cyst. I have an appointment now to have a full hysterectomy (my choice as I want no risk of anything returning). As the cyst is classed as suspicious. 
I believe if you arrange for ultra sounds to be done at the same appointment as women having smear tests. We can reduce the risk of other women living with these possibly life threatening undetected growths.

attributes.action: Make adult adoption legal in the UK
attributes.background: Many people today do not live in traditional nuclear families; and many children form a stronger bond with a step-parent or relationship with someone of a similar nature as opposed to a biological parent.
attributes.additional_details:
It seems, for many reasons, children and their potential adopters don't get the opportunity to discuss and/or execute adoption until the child has reached legal adulthood; and by this point the UK government no longer views the said child as eligible for adoption.
The implications of this are social and legal issues that arise later in life surrounding the relationship between child and, for example, step-parent.
I believe the 2002 UK Adoption and Children Act is outdated for modern day Britain.

attributes.action: Support our teachers in the UK and protect our children's education.
Impose mandatory custodial sentences for assaults on Emergency service personnel
attributes.background: To reduce assaults on emergency service personnel a strong deterrent must be in place. Anyone convicted of such an offence should receive a mandatory custodial prison sentence.
attributes.additional_details:
Emergency service personnel in this country work day in day out, 24 hours a day 365 days a year, putting themselves in life and death situations to help members of the public.

Far to often we see stories on the news of paramedics, police officers and fire fighters being subjected to countless assaults and sustaining injuries affecting their ability to work whilst also reducing the capacity of these services to continue to provide a full service to those who need it.

The only way to reduce this is to send a strong message that it WILL NOT be tolerated and to introduce a strong deterrent to anyone believing they can engage in such behaviour without serious consequences. As such anyone convicted of such a crime should be handed a mandatory custodial sentence.

attributes.action: Thinner lenses be free on the NHS for those registered partially sighted/blind
attributes.background: I was registered as partially sighted at 16 and blind at 19. My eyesight is constantly deteriorating and at a quicker pace than most. The need for glasses is essential. I now require complex lenses, thinner lenses are essential and they are very costly.
attributes.additional_details:
Those with complex lenses do get a voucher but that only equates to approximately £14. One pair of glasses cost me nearly £300.

The buy one get one free offers advertised do not include thinner lenses so if a second pair is required (eg prescription sunglasses which with some conditions light has a major impact) you have to pay twice for the lenses.

I currently have thinner lenses in my latest pair and from the side they are at least 0.75cm thick so would be considerably worse without
